conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
For a cyclic process, ΔU = 0, so Q = W.
Work done by the gas is the area enclosed by the cycle on the PV diagram.
Cycle path is A→B→C→D→A with segments: A→B (isobaric), B→C (isochoric), C→D (isobaric), D→A (isochoric).
Calculate work done for A→B: W_AB = PΔV = 1×10^5 Pa × 1 L = 1×10^5 J.
Calculate work done for B→C: W_BC = 0 (volume is constant).
Calculate work done for C→D: W_CD = PΔV = 0.75×10^5 Pa × (-1 L) = -0.75×10^5 J.
Calculate work done for D→A: W_DA = 0 (volume is constant).
Sum the work done: W_total = 1×10^5 J + 0 J - 0.75×10^5 J + 0 J = 0.25×10^5 J.
Calculate heat exchange Q: Q = W = 0.25×10^5 J.
